definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Some investors even raked in up to 40 percent in profits.
sentences.chinese: 一些投资者甚至迅速赚得高达40%的利润。

definition: both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to make a profit/to earn a packet
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
